comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: The trials and tribulations of island life as felt by the poor auld cattle.  It goes to show that horns on steers had their uses after all.  If you can control the animals head you can control the animal!  The poor thing must have been terrified?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Presumably fairly traumatic! And it can't have been much fun for the men either.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 32465819@N05
comment._content: Seems I read something about this in Tomás Ó Crohan's 'The Islandman' ... brutal, but what else to be done? Why, 'tis enough to curdle a cow's milk for life, and scare the hair of any self respecitng bull.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/32465819@N05] Presumably it was a case of "Thank God we're surrounded by water!" except when we have to transport livestock...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
